unnormalised: Hey folks, looking to buy your dream home in India? Let's talk home loan schemes! Navigating them can feel like trying to untangle Diwali lights, right?
normalised: Hey folks, looking to buy your dream home in India? Let's talk home loan schemes! Navigating them can feel like trying to untangle Diwali lights, right?

unnormalised: There are tons of options out there from banks like HDFC, SBI, and ICICI Bank. Each has different interest rates and eligibility criteria. Fixed rate, floating rate, hybrid... it's a whole world!
normalised: There are tons of options out there from banks like H D F C, S B I, and I C I C I Bank. Each has different interest rates and eligibility criteria. Fixed rate, floating rate, hybrid... it's a whole world!

unnormalised: Generally, the amount you can borrow depends on your income, credit score (CIBIL is key!), and the value of the property. Banks typically finance up to 75-90% of the property value, so be prepared for that down payment.
normalised: Generally, the amount you can borrow depends on your income, credit score (C I B I L is key!), and the value of the property. Banks typically finance up to seventy five to ninety percent of the property value, so be prepared for that down payment.

unnormalised: Schemes like the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) offer subsidies if you meet certain income requirements. Definitely worth checking out, especially for first-time homebuyers.
normalised: Schemes like the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (P M A Y) offer subsidies if you meet certain income requirements. Definitely worth checking out, especially for first-time homebuyers.

unnormalised: When comparing loans, look beyond just the interest rate. Check processing fees, prepayment charges (if you want to pay off the loan faster), and any hidden costs. Trust me, nobody wants a financial shock after a big celebration like Onam!
normalised: When comparing loans, look beyond just the interest rate. Check processing fees, prepayment charges (if you want to pay off the loan faster), and any hidden costs. Trust me, nobody wants a financial shock after a big celebration like Onam!

unnormalised: Don’t forget to shop around! Talk to different banks, and maybe even a mortgage broker, to get the best deal. Consider the EMI you’ll be paying for the next 15-20 years, Rs. 20,000 or Rs. 30,000, so it needs to be comfortable for your budget.
normalised: Don’t forget to shop around! Talk to different banks, and maybe even a mortgage broker, to get the best deal. Consider the E M I you’ll be paying for the next fifteen to twenty years, rupees twenty thousand or rupees thirty thousand, so it needs to be comfortable for your budget.

unnormalised: And finally, get all the documents in order – Aadhaar card, PAN card, income proof, property papers – the works! Makes the process smoother than a plate of delicious biryani. Good luck finding your perfect home!
normalised: And finally, get all the documents in order – Aadhaar card, P A N card, income proof, property papers – the works! Makes the process smoother than a plate of delicious biryani. Good luck finding your perfect home!
